aa_arc_gauge module

! @brief Implementation of circular Anti-Aliased (“AA”) gauges with gradient coloring.

class aa_arc_gauge.AA_Gauge(screen, curr_val=None, in_min=0, in_max=100, radius=30, origin=(50, 50), weight=3, color=(255, 0, 0), empty_arc_color=(96, 96, 96), CURR_FONT=Font('/home/pi/Sensor_Scripts/pygame_code/tricorder/assets/saved_fonts/HelveticaNeue.ttc'), main_font_size=28, FONT_COLOR=(255, 255, 255), solid_bg_color=(0, 0, 0), range_color=(63, 63, 63), range_font=Font('/home/pi/Sensor_Scripts/pygame_code/tricorder/assets/saved_fonts/HelveticaNeue.ttc'), range_font_size=24, suffix='', print_num=True, solid_bg=False, draw_empty_arc=True, print_range=True, print_title=True, title='', title_font_size=18, title_font=Font('/home/pi/Sensor_Scripts/pygame_code/tricorder/assets/saved_fonts/Federation.ttf'), title_font_color=(144, 144, 144), auto_lims=True, offset=45)

Bases: object

! Generic class for an anti-aliased circular gauge with gradient coloring.

@section Description Defines the base class utilized by all pages.

@section Main Components - Radius - Range: min and max vals –autolims - Arc color - Background arc color - Weight - Title - Font: type, size, color

adjust_gauge_lims()

Sets min/max limits to nearest round numbers.

blit_gauge(new_val, print_val=None)

Render and return gauge as surface.

init_origin()

Calculates origin (x,y) for gauge.

init_radius(new_radius)

Saves radius and diameter for faster execution.

update_boundries()

Calculates bounding rectabgle.

update_val(new_val)

Uodate current value.

aa_arc_gauge.fps_manager(clock, screen, fps_array)

For testing performance. Not used in normal execcution.

aa_arc_gauge.handle_events()

For testing. Not used in normal execcution.
